description: This is a Python test script designed to perform local testing of an AWS Lambda handler function named `lambda_handler`. It includes multiple test functions to simulate API Gateway events for different endpoints and request types, checking responses and outputting relevant information.

methods.name: test_bears_endpoint()
methods.description: Tests the /api/bears GET endpoint by simulating an API Gateway event and printing the response details.

methods.name: test_health_endpoint()
methods.description: Tests the health check endpoint (GET /) by simulating an API Gateway event and printing the response.

methods.name: test_cors_preflight()
methods.description: Tests an OPTIONS preflight request for CORS by simulating an API Gateway event and printing response headers.

methods.name: test_not_found()
methods.description: Simulates a GET request to an unknown path to test handling of 404 errors.

methods.name: test_method_not_allowed()
methods.description: Simulates a POST request to an endpoint where only GET may be supported to check 405 handling.
